Name: Issue 277
Introduction: Happy Friday everyone. Another week full of articles and videos from the community.  Definitely enough to keep you busy during the weekend.   Speaking of the weekend, remember that [ReactiveUI Virtual Conf](https://www.rxuiconf.net/) is on this weekend so jump on that.  ❤ Kym

Articles.Title: Mobile App Redesign For Developers: Iconography & Magic Numbers
Articles.Description: Even small details like adding Icons or providing the right amount of Spacing, can make a significant impact in our overall design and by doing so we can make a clean, coherent, and attractive UI for our users.
Articles.Author: Luis Pujols

Articles.Title: Clean temp files and directories in your projects
Articles.Description: Another approach for deleting the bin & obj folders in each sub-directory of your solution. This time with the added thrill of git command line.
Articles.Author: Saamer Mansoor

Articles.Title: Neumorphic animations
Articles.Description: This is a great little tip for creating animated concave and convex fancy buttons using our best friends Sharpnado.Shadows and PancakeView.
Articles.Author: Jean-Marie Parent

Articles.Title: Video Background in Xamarin.Forms
Articles.Description: How to create a full screen video background in Xamarin.Forms using the experimental Media Element.
Articles.Author: Joe Meyer

Articles.Title: MVVM With Xamarin.Forms and JetBrains Rider
Articles.Description: Khalid looks at the Model View View Model (MVVM) pattern and how it changes a solution’s profile and his approach to building mobile experiences. Khalid is also using Jetbrains Rider, another popular IDE for developing Xamarin.Forms applications.
Articles.Author: Khalid Abuhakmeh

Articles.Title: Animate A Mic Drop with Xamarin.Forms
Articles.Description: Khalid bashes together emojis and animation to create an animated mic drop. A useful article if you want to learn a bit about composing animations.
Articles.Author: Khalid Abuhakmeh

Articles.Title: The future of .NET Standard
Articles.Description: Since .NET 5 was announced, many of you have asked what this means for .NET Standard and whether it will still be relevant. In this post, Immo Landwerth explains how .NET 5 improves code sharing and replaces .NET Standard. I’ll also cover the cases where you still need .NET Standard.
Articles.Author: Immo Landwerth

Articles.Title: Can Microsoft Finally Unify Desktop and Mobile Development?
Articles.Description: Microsoft has almost made it to the finish line with .NET 5, their ambitious platform unification project. For the first time since 2016 — when Microsoft introduced .NET Core and created a parallel track for cross-platform development — all .NET applications will be back together under one roof. What about Maui and .NET 6?
Articles.Author: Matthew MacDonald

Articles.Title: Building a Notifications client with Xamarin and Azure - Part 3
Articles.Description: The continuing adventures of building a Cross Platform Notification client for Xamarin with Azure.
Articles.Author: Frank Boucher

Articles.Title: Gerald.Codes()
Articles.Description: Gerald has been pumping out so many good Xamarin bite sized videos recently that you should do yourself a favor and go check them out.
Articles.Author: Gerald Versluis

Articles.Title: Toronto Mobile .NET Developers Meetup - Mobile App Redesign for Devs
Articles.Description: Polishing and working with UI/UX design can feel intimidating and like we definitely need a Designer in our team to get out a production-ready app design. In this talk, you will be able to learn key tools, resources, and workflow you can use to start building clean and immersive app designs.
Articles.Author: Toronto Mobile Developers

Articles.Title: Webinar - Xamarin, MAUI and the reactive MVVM between them
Articles.Description: ReactiveUI is a MVVM framework based on Reactive Extensions, which are a cross language approach to functional programming. During this talk we will take a trip through Xamarin, MVVM, ReactiveUI and show the future state of Xamarin, MAUI.
Articles.Author: Rodney Littles II

Articles.Title: The Xamarin Show - Xamarin.Forms Code Snippets
Articles.Description: This week, James is joined by Damien Doumer, Microsoft MVP, who shows off some of his favorite code snippets for Xamarin.Forms and how you can create your own.
Articles.Author: James Montemagno

Articles.Title: Null Pointers 18: AI
Articles.Description: Artificial Intelligence or AI for short is all around us it seems.
Articles.Author: Null Pointers

Articles.Title: Merge Conflict 219: Move over float, it is time for Half
Articles.Description: Is it possible for us to talk about a new floating point time in .NET for 30 minutes and make it super fun? Find out!
Articles.Author: Merge Conflict
